Even when it was meant to be a DC exclusive and is a short story, it is still a very good expansion for the Half-Life Universe

Fun and faithful to the original Half Life! A bit short maybe, but the puzzles were challenging and the story was more in depth than the original game. A bit more combat would have been better. 4/5

Blue shift is the low point of HL:1. It doesn't add anything to the series, not only do you not get all the guns seen previously, but you also don't fight all the enemies, I think. While Gordon and Aidan got bosses, Barney only got like three marines, that he didn't even have to kill. All that Blue Shift added to Half Life was an explanation of how some people got out of black mesa. Over all, Blue Shift is the most skipable HL:1 expansion. The only time I'd recommend you play this is if you need more Half Life or if you have an extra hour or two and this game from the bundle. 4/10

8/10 Successful but not as the original game.

 Half-Life: Blue Shift is a different view of the original game from the eyes of a security guard or "Barney". As with others you try to escape the lab.

 There is not really much to say except its weak and short but it adds something to the main game. You should see this as a DLC for Original Half Life. The game does not add anything spectacular to already existing mechanics. The armor etc are hard to come by but you are still as strong.

 If you liked the original Half Life you would like this game. Just don't expect to be a full game.

10/10 Great game
Definately play after Op4 due to this games clean ending it will leave you satisfied with all 3 games as a whole and give you a jumping off point for HL2.  While lacking new weapons and bosses it is chocked full of deail and new plot coinciding with the Half Life timeline. It has great characters and i love the setting being simaler to portal 2 going through older sections of black mesa from 1950s and 1970s.
While not as solid as the og game or it's other expansion, Half-Life: Blue Shift offers a decent short romp with a heavy focus on puzzles.
pretty good

Subject: Half Life: Blue Shift
Occupation: Second Expansion for Half life
Rating: 8.5/10
Comments:

This game is a huge step down from Opposing Force, if you have to pick one pick that one. This is still a great game but it's wayyyy too short. That being said i think it does a good job of forging it's own path, it's a short and concise story which is fine but i don't think it's really labelled that way. I was expecting it to be about as long as opposing force but i finished it in 1/3rd the time on hard mode. 
I know that it's commonly sold in a bundle and i would 100% recommend getting it there but compared to Half Life and Opposing Force i feel it serves as the little brother of the two. Half Life is something i think everyone should play, Opposing Force is something i think any Half Life fans should play but this is just a short add on. Honestly it would fit right in with story DLC these days. 
I know this all sounds very negative but what you should know is that despite it's length it is still a very fun game with a lot of fun puzzles and new takes on old ones despite the fact that it brings nothing new to the table.

[h1] A Quick-To-Complete Side Story Of The Workers At Black Mesa [/h1]

I'll keep this short. This game tells the tale from a different perspective; from the eyes of a security guard who sees the events within Black Mesa while Gordon is causing chaos. 

That's all there is to say really. You see how your actions link to Gordon's story in loose ways, which is rather interesting and meta, but your character (Barney) has his own story to tell. He must find an important scientist who gets captured by the military, to whom needs your help securing his teleporting project to Xen, then escape from Black Mesa with a bunch of other scientists. It's pretty basic and doesn't last long.

There's nothing new, really. I suppose one new dynamic is the lack of the HEV suit, so you must rely on body armour scattered around. You fight the same enemies as Gordon, manage to find some of Gordon's original arsenal, but come across the more casual workers of Black Mesa. 

There's honestly not much to say. It's a good 2 hours of fun, but there's no reason to return, it's not as replayable as the core game or memorable. If you're playing Half-Life 2, then this introduces Barney but this game is definitely not necessary to play. Buy when on sale and enjoy a movie length side plot. It's more Half-Life.

Absolute classic of a game. If you have played any of the games in the series I would recommend playing this and all of the other older ones. Blue Shift, Opposing Force and the og Half Life are a great story with amazing mechanics. Thanks to recent updates the graphics are better than the original, which makes playthroughs much easier. This game takes all of the best parts of FPS, puzzle, and strategy games and mashes them into an immersive world well before its time. Enjoy,

I really liked the different perspective this game gives you, to show you whats going on from the perspective of a security guard who was at work. I liked the little side story and how you could come across the odd scene from the main game. It is much shorter then the main game and opposing force but I still really liked it. Weapon variety is very small compared to the others but just right for the length that this game is.

About 2 hours of more Half Life is neat, although get it on sale because again, 2 hours.

It's a pretty decent expansion pack. Nowhere near as big as Opposing Force is, and doesn't even let you use the full Half-Life arsenal. It's only a couple hours long if it's your first time, so it's a short game. Still worth your money, though, but I'd definitely play Opposing Force over this, it has a lot more content in it.
